Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the tomato defensin family
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.23124812]Gram-positive bacteria:Staphylococcus aureus A170 (MIC=40 μg/mL), Staphylococcus epidermidis (MIC=40 μg/mL), Listeria monocytogenes (MIC=40 μg/mL);Gram-negative bacteria:Salmonella enterica serovar Paratyphi (MIC=15 μg/mL), Escherichia coli (MIC=15 μg/mL), Helicobacter pylori VB1 (MIC=15 μg/mL), Helicobacter pylori VB2 (MIC=10 μg/mL), Helicobacter pylori VB3 (MIC=15 μg/mL), Helicobacter pylori VB4 (MIC=12 μg/mL), Helicobacter pylori VB5 (MIC=15 μg/mL), Helicobacter pylori VB6 (MIC=10 μg/mL), Helicobacter pylori VB7 (MIC=15 μg/mL), Helicobacter pylori VB8 (MIC=10 μg/mL), Helicobacter pylori VB9 (MIC=10 μg/mL), Helicobacter pylori VB10 (MIC=15 μg/mL).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.23124812]<5%  hemolysis at 50 μg/mL against mouse red blood cells.
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial activity against a panel of human pathogens, including H.pylori, and displays anti-inflammatory activity in vitro. Weak hemolytic activity.

Literature.Title: A novel synthetic peptide from a tomato defensin exhibits antibacterial activities against Helicobacter pylori.
Literature.Author: Rigano MM, Romanelli A, Fulgione A, Nocerino N, D'Agostino N, Avitabile C, Frusciante L, Barone A, Capuano F, Capparelli R.
